intro: Syngonanthus niveus, commonly known as the snowflax, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its white, star-like flowers bloom in late summer, adding a striking visual element to its habitat. Syngonanthus niveus is known for its resilience to harsh mountain climates and is often found in meadows and slopes at high elevations.
